sen.j: この和約に従って同年10月5日（ユリウス暦1392年11月19日）、南朝の後亀山天皇が吉野から京都に帰還して、北朝の後小松天皇に三種の神器を譲って退位して南北朝の合一が図られた。
sen.e: According to this agreement, Emperor Gokameyama of the Southern Dynasty came back from Yoshino to Kyoto on 5 October in the same year (November 19, 1392 according to the Julian calendar) and he returned the three sacred treasures to Emperor Gokomatsu of the Northern Dynasty, he then abdicated from the position and the Northern and the Southern Dynasties unified into one.

sen.j: これによって、建武3年（1336年）以来、南北朝時代に分裂していた日本の天皇の地位及び朝廷の分裂状態が終了した。

sen.j: 50年以上わたる南北朝の争いは、途中南朝が優勢に立って北朝を一時解体に追い込んだ事（正平一統）もあったものの、次第に北朝を擁立した足利尊氏が開いた室町幕府が全国の武士を掌握するにつれて北朝側優位の流れが固まりつつあった。
sen.e: The conflict continued more than fifty years between Northern and the Southern Dynasties was gradually ended with the priority position of the Northern Dynasty, as Takauji ASHIKAGA gradually established the Northern Dynasty and opened the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by shogun) and controlled the Samurai all over Japan, although the Southern Dynasty once was in the priority position and nearly took the political power from the Northern Dynasty.
